intro: Rhynchanthera hispida, commonly known as the rough rhynchanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
